chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane H Landvatter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling AMENDED FROM Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh AMENDED FROM Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week during the first year of probation and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

Defendant Shane H Landvatter in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Shall reside w/Mother, Julie Hackman during the duration of this case. He must follow all of her rules.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim HD and KL (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.

Defendant Shane H Landvatter in court with attorney Patrick K Cafferty.  Christopher D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
